required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Twice Daily 60mg AZD9668 in COPD for 12 Weeks in Patients on Background Budesonide/Formoterol
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-Week, Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multinational, Phase IIb Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of 60mg AZD9668 Administered Orally Twice Daily to Subjects With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) on Treatment With Budesonide/Formoterol

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate the efficacy of AZD9668 compared with placebo in symptomatic COPD patients by assessing the effects on lung function and symptoms of COPD

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) as a measure of lung function, measured before bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)

secondary_outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) as a measure of lung function, measured after bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)

End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)

End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)
Forced expiratory flow between 25% to 75% of vital capacity (FEF25-75%) as a measure of lung function, measured after bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)
Inspiratory capacity (IC) as a measure of lung function, measured before bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)
Inspiratory capacity (IC) as a measure of lung function, measured after bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
End of treatment value - week 12 for completers, otherwise Last Observation Carried forward (LOCF)

secondary_outcome.measure: PEF - Baseline Measured by Patient at Home (L/Min) in the Morning
secondary_outcome.description: Peak Expiratory Flow (L/min) as a measure of lung function, measured at home by the patient each morning. Baseline is the mean of last 10 days of data before start of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: PEF - End-value Measured by Patient at Home (L/Min) in the Morning
secondary_outcome.description: Peak expiratory flow (PEF)

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 - Baseline Measured by Patient at Home (L) in the Morning
secondary_outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (L) as a measure of lung function, measured at home by the patient each morning. Baseline is the mean of last 10 days of data before start of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 - End-value Measured by Patient at Home (L) in the Morning
secondary_outcome.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (L)

EXAcerbations of Chronic pulmonary disease Tool, patient questionnaire as a measure of respiratory symptoms (reported as units on a 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status) scale). Baseline is the mean of last 10 days of data before start of treatment.
EXAcerbations of Chronic pulmonary disease Tool, patient questionnaire as a measure of respiratory symptoms (reported as units on a 0 (best health status) to 100 (worst possible status) scale).

Breathlessness, Cough and Sputum Scale, patient reported questionnaire as a measure of respiratory symptoms (reported on a 0 (best health status) to 12 (worst possible status) scale). Baseline is the mean of last 10 days of data before start of treatment.
Breathlessness, Cough and Sputum Scale, patient reported questionnaire as a measure of respiratory symptoms (reported on a 0 (best health status) to 12 (worst possible status) scale).
Sputum Colour as assessed by the Bronkotest scale, reported on a scale from 1 - clear (best health status) to 5 - dark green (worst possible health status).
Sputum Colour as assessed by the Bronkotest scale, reported on a scale from 1 - clear (best health status) to 5 - dark green (worst possible health status). End of treatment week 12
Daily average of number of inhalations of reliever medication
Endurance time (s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incremental Shuttle Walk Test - End Value

secondary_outcome.description: Endurance time (s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Endurance Shuttle Walk Test - End Value
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed at vist 6 -( last on treatment clinic visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (COPD) - Overall Score at Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, as a measure of Quality of Life (reported on a scale from 0 (best health status) to 100(worst possible status)).

secondary_outcome.measure: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire (COPD) - End-value Overall Score
secondary_outcome.description: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, as a measure of Quality of Life (reported on a scale from 0 (best health status) to 100(worst possible status)).Questionaire assessed on vist 6 -( last on treatment clinic visit)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of the the treatment period - 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients having a clinic defined disease exacerbation.

intervention.description: 2 x 30 mg oral tablets bd for 12 weeks
2 x matched placebo to oral tablet bd for 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of COPD with symptoms over 1 year
- FEV1/FVC < 70% and FEV1 >= 30 and < 80 % of predicted post-bronchodilator
- Symptomatic COPD for a total of 7 days in the two weeks prior to randomisation
- At least 1 COPD exacerbation from 4 weeks to 12 months before the screening visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Past history or current evidence of clinically significant heart disease
- Current diagnosis of asthma
- Patients who require long term oxygen therapy
- Worsening of COPD requiring treatment with antibiotics, an increase in inhaled steroid dose and/or oral steroids within 4 weeks of study visit 1b

overall_official.affiliation: Samodzielny Publiczny ZOZ Uniwersytecki Szpital Kliniczny

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First patient enrolled 24 November 2009. Last patient completed 18 August 2010. Study conducted at 79 centres in 6 countries (Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Romania, Slovakia).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 3- or 4-week run-in period on budesonide/formoterol twice daily to stabilise patients on maintenance therapy before randomisation. Patients already on budesonide/formoterol required a 3-week run-in period and patients on ICS as monotherapy or in combination with any long-acting bronchodilator required a 4-week run-in period.

group.title: 60 mg AZD9668
group.description: AZD9668 2x30 mg oral tablets twice daily (bid) for 12 weeks

outcome.title: Baseline Pre-bronchodilator FEV1 (L)
outcome.description: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) as a measure of lung function, measured before bronchodilator (salbutamol) use in the clinic.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set for each outcome measure includes those patients who received at least one dose of investigational product and for whom a baseline and at least one post-randomisation measurement is available for that outcome measure. Patients were analysed by to randomised treatment in accordance with the intention to treat principle.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
